content.text: Integrate LangChain DeepAgent framework into BrightHive platform.
- Research LangChain DeepAgent capabilities and architecture
- Access to LangChain's extensive agent ecosystem
Integrate AWS Bedrock Core Agent into BrightHive platform.
- Research AWS Bedrock Core Agent features and capabilities

Cleaned Demo Client workspace and developed cleanup automation scripts for production environments. Reduces costs and maintains clean infrastructure state.

**Files implemented:**
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-data-organization-cdk/delete_nat_gateways.py` - NAT Gateway cleanup
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-scripts/aws-accounts-management/account_operations.py` - Account management
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-scripts/aws-accounts-management/operations/` - S3 and resource cleanup scripts

**Cleanup automation:**
- Identify unused NAT Gateways (high cost)
- Delete old S3 snapshots
- Remove unused EBS volumes
- Clean up orphaned security groups
- Tag resources for automatic cleanup

**Cost savings:**
- NAT Gateway: ~$30-45/month per gateway
- S3 storage: Variable based on data size
- EBS volumes: ~$0.10/GB-month

**Safety measures:**
- Dry-run mode for all scripts
- Approval required for production
- Backup before deletion
- CloudWatch alarms for unexpected deletions
Important cost optimization work reducing AWS spend. Maintains clean infrastructure state. Prevents resource sprawl and improves manageability.

summary: Fix BrightAgent Credential Retrieval (Secret Manager Migration)

content.text: Resolved regression bug causing credential retrieval failure in BrightAgent. Migrated password fetching directly to AWS Secrets Manager, eliminating dependency on intermediate services.
Migrate credential retrieval to Secrets Manager
Update BrightAgent agents to use new retrieval
Credentials retrieved directly from Secrets Manager
All agents using new credential retrieval

**Files modified:**
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brightbot/brightbot/tools/aws/secrets_manager.py` - SecretsManagerClient for credential retrieval
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brightbot/brightbot/tools/aws/async_secrets_manager.py` - Async wrapper
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brightbot/brightbot/agents/*/` - Agent updates to use Secrets Manager

**Implementation:**
- Direct boto3 Secrets Manager integration
- Workspace-scoped secret naming convention
- Async credential retrieval for performance
- Credential caching with TTL
- Error handling and fallback logic

**Secrets naming:**
- Pattern: `{workspace_id}/credentials/{service}`
- Automatic secret rotation support
- IAM role-based access control
Critical bug fix ensuring BrightAgent can retrieve credentials properly. Prevents service disruptions and improves reliability. Simplifies architecture by removing intermediate layers.

Deploy Airbyte EC2 instance in Virginia

summary: Create Security Group Audit Script & Document Neo4j Lockdown

content.text: Created automation script to audit AWS Security Groups for wide-open ports and documented the Neo4j access lockdown process. Prevents unauthorized network access to critical infrastructure.
Security Group audit script for wide-open ports
GCP Cloud Run IP range management
Script identifies Security Groups with 0.0.0.0/0 rules
GCP Cloud Run IP ranges properly configured

**Files implemented:**
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-scripts/scripts/update_security_group.sh` - Manages Neo4j Security Group ingress rules (port 7687)
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-platform-core/brighthive_core/redis_stack.py` - VPC security group configuration
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-platform-core/CLAUDE.md` - Neo4j security documentation

**Security Group audit criteria:**
- Identify rules allowing 0.0.0.0/0 (all IPs)
- Flag overly permissive port ranges
- Validate GCP Cloud Run IP range access for Neo4j
- Check for unused security groups

**Neo4j lockdown:**
- Port 7687 restricted to GCP Cloud Run IP ranges
- No public internet access
- Security group rules managed via automation script
Important security control ensuring network access is properly restricted. Part of firewall review and infrastructure hardening. Prevents unauthorized database access.
Fixed organization creation automation by migrating from personal credentials to GitHub Apps. Enables reliable, scalable org provisioning via CDK. Needs to be implemented in CDK code.
Migrate from personal GitHub credentials to GitHub Apps
CDK implementation for GitHub Apps integration

**Files modified:**
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-admin/src/api/create_organization.py` - Main org creation orchestrator
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brighthive-admin/src/api/resources/process_orchestration/sfn_create_ws_org.py` - Step Functions workflow
- `/Users/bado/iccha/brighthive/brightbot/brightbot/tools/github_oauth.py` - GitHub Apps authentication

**Implementation:**
- Replace personal access tokens with GitHub Apps credentials
- Update CDK stacks to use GitHub Apps
- Store GitHub Apps credentials in Secrets Manager
- Update Step Functions for new auth flow

**Benefits:**
- More secure (no personal credentials)
- Better audit trail
- Supports organization-level permissions
- Scalable for multiple admins
Important infrastructure improvement enabling reliable org provisioning. Removes dependency on personal credentials. Critical for scaling customer onboarding.
